definition: complicated and simple/traditional and simplified form of Chinese characters
complicated/many/in great numbers/abbr. for 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3], traditional form of Chinese characters
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

sentences.english: Tom Riddle would kill Lord Voldemort, and it would be the last thing he did.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆謎語將殺死繁簡體轉換，而這是最後的事情來做。

sentences.english: There are also comparisons between Simplified and Traditional characters, and many multimedia enhancements.
sentences.chinese: 其內有生字繁簡對照，及多媒體補充教材。

sentences.english: He's venerating the room that Seymour and Buddy occupied.
sentences.chinese: 在對西莫和巴蒂住的繁簡保佑崇敬之情。

sentences.english: The ten chapters explain multifarious contents but are contextual corresponding and structural complete.
sentences.chinese: 十章雖內容有別，繁簡不同，然前後相應，密不可分。

sentences.english: Characters and Their Standardization in Hong Kong, …
sentences.chinese: 試論香港繁簡字的運用及其規範。

definition: pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
standard form (of a Chinese character)/plain font style (as opposed to bold or italic)/printed style (as opposed to cursive)/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
